content.rendered:
[vc_row pix_particles_check=””][vc_column][vc_column_text]What are the best courses after 12th for commerce students? Which is the most suitable course for a commerce background student? These are some of the questions that are most frequently asked by commerce students looking to get a head start in their careers. The current educational market is flooded with plenty of career options. Several institutions are coming up with short-term as well as long-term skill-based courses for 12th pass-outs. Certainly, it confuses students regarding their career options and passion as well. We understand that choosing the right career immediately after 12th grade is always a challenging decision. Thus, to break down your chaos we have prepared a comprehensive guide to help you determine which course is perfect for you after completing your 12th as a commerce student. Also, we have mentioned various degree programs for commerce students. Let’s get started with the guide that incorporates what courses you want to enroll for courses after 12th for commerce and how you can boost your career by doing these courses after 12th for commerce stream. Here we go.  

How To Choose the Right Courses After 12th For Commerce?

Choosing the right courses after 12th for commerce stream is not an easy task.   However, you need to be aware of all the available courses that you can pursue after completing your 12th. Next, you need to analyze your areas of interest and try to align them with the available courses.  Now, make a list of courses that you are interested in and analyze their pros and cons along with the employment opportunities that are available after doing the course. This is how you can choose the right courses after 12th for commerce.
  • Filtering out the interesting and relevant courses
  • Examining the syllabus and subjects
  • Inspecting the eligibility, course duration, and fee.
Now, Let’s get started with all the best courses after 12th for commerce courses that you must acknowledge.  

Top 12 Courses After 12th For Commerce Students

Commerce is a field that acquires vast aspects of business, ranging from Finance, Human resources, Digital Marketing, Accounting, Law, and many more.  Here we have listed all the courses after 12th for commerce stream that you should go for. Let’s proceed!

1. Certification in Digital Marketing

Digital marketing is a rising industry with numerous job and growth opportunities for newcomers. Anyone irrespective of their educational background can join this course for up-skilling and become an expert in this domain. Therefore, Digital Marketing help students to boost their career with courses after 12th for commerce. Digital marketing is separated into 8 major categories including-
  • Search Engine Optimization,
  • Pay-per-Click,
  • Social Media Marketing,
  • Content Marketing,
  • Email Marketing,
  • Mobile Marketing,
  • Marketing Analytics, &
  • Affiliate Marketing.
But, how can you learn digital marketing? There are several ways of learning digital marketing which we will go through ahead in the guide.  

How To Learn Digital Marketing?

Digital marketing is one of the best career options to pursue if you are looking for a field with great job and growth opportunities. You can learn the basics of digital marketing by reading blogs & watching videos on YouTube. However, to become a pro, it is important to enroll in a good digital marketing institute, where you can learn from basic to advanced technologies and improve your skills as a digital marketer. For detailed information, you can go through 1. Best Digital Marketing Course in Delhi 2. Best Digital Marketing Course in Noida 3. Best Digital Marketing Course in Gurgaon  

Scope In Digital Marketing

Marketing methods have evolved with the advancement in internet technology. The ways people used to perceive information have changed completely. Radio advertising shifted to TV advertising, which then pivoted to digital marketing due to the rise in internet usage.   While TV remains a major promotion platform for several businesses, digital marketing enables organizations to interact with their audience globally using online mediums. Check out the following stats across India:
  • The market size of the digital advertising industry was around 47 Billion in 2015. It went up to INR 116.3 in 2018, and in the 2020 financial year, it reached INR 199 billion.
  • Furthermore, a large growth of digital marketing will create a market up to INR 539 billion by the year 2025.
Very few are aware of digitalization across the country. The below statistics will give you a glimpse of the growth in digital marketing.
  1. 60 – 65 million jobs by 2025
  2. $1 Trillion – the potential economic value of India’s economy by 2025
  3. Ranking 2nd globally in digital adoption after China

2. Certificate in Banking

Banking courses are available directly after completing the 12th standard. Students can join the course in any of the two formats: online or offline. Well, this is one of the best short-term courses after 12th for commerce pass-outs. Those who are interested in banking and want to start a career in the field should apply. Additionally, you will cover basic fundamentals in the course, such as; data analysis, corporate statistics, and tax regimes. However, the banking certification courses are popular amongst students that acquire time periods ranging from 3 months to 1 year. Following completion of this course, you will be able to apply for jobs such as financial advisor, tax assistant, internal auditor, financial consultant, and so on.     

 3. Certification in Tally

Tally is the most common course that is offered to every student in the commerce stream. Although, it is the robust accounting system used by small and medium-sized businesses for doing the calculations. The Tally course will include various learning opportunities such as; how to use the software, topics, GST and TDS computation, and updating business information. Tally’s accounting features make it simple and quick to record business transactions. However, the course duration is 2 months to 6 months where you can approach various job roles such as; Internal Audit, Finance, Accounts Payable, Tally Operator, Tally Accounts Manager, etc.    

4. Certification in MS Excel

MS Excel is essential for stream students and it is the most popular and common course in the 12th. It is the most widely used software in the market today. Moreover, the software enables several businesses to organize and analyze their data. To understand its complex features and shortcuts, students need to take a course to enhance their skills and upgrade their resumes.  Most students or people learn up to their requirements. Very few reach the level of proficiency. If you are proficient in MS Excel, then you can be recruited in the e-commerce sector and corporate sector with high packages. The course duration of MS Excel is from 2 weeks to 8 months.    

5. Certification in Entrepreneurship

The students are inspired to build their own empires at an early age. Certification in Entrepreneurship helps students learn how to effectively position, operate, and build their own business in life. Nowdays, Entrepreneurship is one of the leading courses after 12th for commerce students who wants to construct their own empire. The topics that are included in this course are; accounting, business, selling, and much more. Besides, the course will help you to brush up on your skills, such as communication skills, business, leadership, negotiation, and much more. The course duration is from 6 months to 1 year. Furthermore, there are many institutes that provide a certificate in entrepreneurship for 12th-grade students. Hence, certification in entrepreneurship is one of the common courses after 12th for commerce.    

Professional Degree Courses After 12th For Commerce

 

1. Bachelor of Commerce (B.Com)

B.com stands for bachelor of Commerce which you can pursue after completing the 12th. We can say, that this is the most common or popular courses after 12th for commerce among students and most of them dive into this course as the academic difficulty is not too high. Another advantage of this course is to go further for the master’s and enhance your knowledge and skills as well. Hence, most of the commerce students enroll for these courses among all courses of 12th in the commerce stream. The duration of the course is 3 years and you can choose the college that provides the integrated course of 5 years completely with no gap in between. Besides, you can explore many job opportunities in the private and government sectors as well as can boost your career.     Eligibility and Syllabus of Course The eligibility of the course is a minimum of 50% marks in 12th or above. Further, the syllabus of the course is mentioned below about this course.
  • Economics
  • Marketing
  • Entrepreneurship
  • Mathematics
  • Business Regulatory Framework
  • Company Laws
  • Corporate Accounting
  • Income Tax
  • Management Accounting
  • Auditing
  • Statistics
  • Human Resource Management
  • Banking and Insurance
 

2. Chartered Accountancy (CA)

Chartered accountancy is a profession that manages financial accounts of companies and businesses following the laws set by the government. If you want to become CA then, you need to pursue the Chartered Accountant professional course and you may be a member of the Institute of Chartered Accountants of India.  Want to enroll for courses after 12th for commerce to get high salary? Well, to be a member of ICAI you need to attend the CPT exam. You can appear for the exam after completing your 12th. As you need to clear the CPT exam to appear for C.A final exam. Lastly, you will be in the position of Chartered Accountant. Although, studying for C.A is tough but the career prospects are exciting.         Eligibility and Syllabus of Course The minimum 50% percentage is in 12th and if you are a commerce graduate then you need a minimum of 55% to become C.A.
  • Accounting
  • Economics
  • Taxation
  • Tax Laws
  • Auditing
  • Business Laws
  • Financial Management
  • Business Communication
  • Corporate Laws
 

3. Company Secretary (CS)

CS stands for company secretary and is a demanding profile in the commerce stream after the 12th. Although, it is one of the most popular courses among all courses after 12th for commerce stream. The company secretaryship course is programmed by the Institute of Company Secretaries of India which is affiliated with the government. To become CS, you need to get selected for the CS course offered by ICSI where you will be exploring the three stages program mentioned below;
  • Foundation Program
  • Executive Program
  • Professional Program
After completing the course, you will be open to many offers and ample private job opportunities as well.    

4. Bachelor of Economics (BE)

Boost career with courses after 12th for commerce by pursuing Bachelor of Economics. It is a three-year program and many folks are pursuing this course. As it is one of the popular courses after 12th for commerce. One or another student is going for this course and here you will be analyzing the production, distribution, and consumption of goods and services.         Eligibility and Syllabus Of Course Minimum 50% required for enrolling in BE course or equivalent CGPA.
  • Business Organization and Office Management
  • Computer Applications: MS Office
  • English-I
  • Introduction of Information Technology
  • Language-I
  • Principles of Accountancy
 

5. Hotel Management Course

Bachelor of hotel management is an undergraduate course where you will deal with numerous fundamentals of hotel management. Moreover, it is one of the best courses after 12th for commerce students who like to eat and cook while discovering or traveling around. The course is one of the popular courses for the 12th pass-out batch to get a kick-start career. For the course of 3 years with 6 semesters where you will go through the various projects and assignments along with an internship to get placed in big firms.          Eligibility and Syllabus of Course The percentage should be a minimum of 50% to get started with the Bachelor of Hotel Management Course with English as a mandatory subject. 
  • Food Production Foundation
  • Food & Beverage Service
  • Food Safety and Hygiene
  • General English
  • Applications to Computers
  • Hotel Accounting
  • Hotel Housekeeping
  • Food Science and Nutrition
  • Food Production Operation
  • Housekeeping Operations
  • Front Office Operations
  • Hotel Costing and Management Accounting
  • Financial Management
  • Travel & Tourism Management
  • Principles of Management
  • Managerial Economics
These are the subjects from which you can select and complete the course smoothly.  Along with this course, there are multiple courses available in the market after completing the 12th. Here you go. 
  • Diploma in Hotel Management
  • BHMCT (Bachelor of Hotel Management and Catering Technology)
  • Diploma in Baking, Beverages, and Catering
  • Bachelor of Hotel and Hospitality Management
  • BHA (Bachelor of Hotel Administration)
  • DHMCT (Diploma in Hotel Management and Catering Technology)
  • B.Sc. Hospitality and Travel Management
  • B.Sc. Hotel and Hospitality Management
These are the related courses in Hotel Management. Now, let’s head over to another course for the 12th pass-out batch. Lastly, hotel management is tied to many relevant sectors like; travel and tourism, etc.   

6. Journalism And Mass Communication Course (BJMC)

Bachelor of Journalism and mass communication course (BJMC) is a very popular course among the courses after 12th for commerce. The bachelor of journalism and mass communication course is a creative course where you need to perform live field projects and much like that.          Mass communication is a broad field that it consists few popular subjects like; 
  • Journalism
  • Advertising
  • Public relations
  • Social media
These four are the main sub-discipline that is common to learn if you want to master your skills. The perspective of the course is to exchange information via mass media with the various segments of the population.  If we go with an example, then you can take the example of Television, you can see the news program that broadcasts all the current affairs and other important to the population. This is how communication works.   

7. Event Management Courses

The event management courses include the various subjects and a diploma course of two years. Whereas, the degree course of three years. The students after passing the 12th standard will be privileged with the career option to learn the event management course that consists of cost estimation, planning and scheduling, and much more.  Well, there are many degree courses for 12th students of commerce stream in which you can boost your career. 
  • BBA in Event Management
  • BMS in Event Management
  • Bachelor of Event Management
  • Diploma in Event Management
  • B.Sc. Hospitality and Event Management
Now, what are the eligibility and the syllabus of the course? Here we have provided a step-by-step method.          Eligibility and Syllabus of the Course You must score a minimum of 50% in the 12th standard and equivalent to that for starting the course in event management. 
  • Event Marketing
  • Event Advertising
  • Event production (Including catering)
  • Event Planning
  • Event Accounting
  • Communication Skills
  • Special Event Topics
These are the subjects that you need to learn if you want to be an expert in event management and the skills you need to learn in event management are;
  • Analyze an assigned event
  • Cost estimation
  • Estimation of materials (food, beverages, decoration & other relevant materials)
  • Planning and scheduling
  • Staff recruitment and management
  • Managing the financial side of the event
  • Logistics management
  • Crowd management
  • Operations/task management
  • Coordinate the event
  • See to legal and contractual obligations
  • Take care of customer service activities
This is how you can master your skills in event management. Going forward, let’s head over to the other courses for the 12th.  

8. Fashion Designing Courses

Fashion designing is a creative course where you will see rapid growth in the market. However, you may see many folks approaching for this course across the country and now, Delhi is the current sea of fashion designing courses available in several institutes.  You can say it is one of the prosperous vocational education streams that are not only expanded in India but in other countries as well. Now, below you will learn the subjects, skills, and eligibility to get started with the course.  The courses after 12th for commerce students are structured below. 
  • B.Des. Fashion Design
  • Bachelor of Fashion Design
  • Diploma in Fashion Design & Technology
  • B.Sc. Fashion Design
Now, the skills you need to learn in fashion designing are followed as; Drawing, Crafting, Textile, and much more you will be acknowledging after pursuing the course.          Eligibility and Syllabus of the Course You need to secure a minimum of 55% to pursue the course of fashion design. However, the syllabus of the course seems curious that will excite you to go with. 
  • Drawing/sketching
  • Computer aided design
  • Textile design
  • Pattern drafting
  • Pattern techniques
  • Fashion sketching/illustration
  • Costume design
  • Apparel design
  • Accessory design
  • Jewellery design
  • Fashion journalism
  • Fashion merchandising
  • Fashion shows/exhibitions
  • Fashion trends
  • Communication skills
These are the subjects in the fashion designing course where you can select a few in which you are strong.   

9. Travel And Tourism Course

The travel and tourism course is expensive. Although, the scope of the travel and tourism course is beyond your expectations. However, the course will provide you the in-depth knowledge of tourism that will include international tourism as well.  The courses consist the various syllabus such as; hospitality, taking care of tourists, travel management, tour management, and much more.      The courses you can pursue in travel and tourism are 
  • BTTM (Bachelor of Travel and Tourism Management)
  • BHTM (Bachelor of Hospitality and Travel Management)
  • B.Sc. Hospitality and Travel Management
  • Diploma in Travel and Tourism Management
Eligibility and Syllabus of the Course A minimum of 50% is required for enrollment in this course. The syllabus of the course is listed below
  • Business Statistics
  • Communication Skills in English
  • Critical Reasoning, Writing, and Presentation
  • Fundamentals of Tourism
  • History of Tourism
  • Financial Accounting
  • Indian Constitution, Secularism and Sustainable Environment
  • Reading Literature in English
  • Tourism Principles Practices and Ethics
  • Translation and Communication in Languages other than English
  • Aviation Management
  • Business Regulatory framework
  • History and Philosophy of Science
  • Literature and Contemporary Issues
  • Tourism in India
  • Culture and Civilization
  • IT for Business
  • Introduction to Hospitality
  • Tourism Industry, Travel Geography, and Travel Management
  • Air Fares & Ticketing
  • Business Research Methods
  • Event Management
  • Hotel Operation
  • Human Resource Management
  • Travel Agency and Tour Operation Management
  • Entrepreneurship Development
  • Innovative Practices in Tourism
  • Principles of Marketing
  • Project Work
 

10. Vocational Course

Vocational courses in the submerge of technical knowledge, artistic, and practical skills as well. The vocational courses id listed among the best options in courses after 12th for commerce students. The vocational course holds most of the practical knowledge and less theoretical knowledge.          For example, here we have listed a few courses that are included in the vocational courses
  • Beautician Courses
  • Foreign Languages
  • Translation
  • Typing
  • Tax Practice and Procedure
  • Foreign Trade and Practices
  • Catering Services
  • Journalism & Media Management
  • Hospitality, Catering, Travel, Tourism and Service Industry
  • Boutique Management
  • Interior Design & Styling
  • Multi-Cuisine Course
  • Diet & Nutrition
  • Sports Nutrition
  • Acting & TV Production
  • Media Programming
  • Non-Linear Editing (Final Cut Pro)
  • Acting & TV Production
These are the courses where you can check out every course according to your preference with a step-by-step method to develop your skills. Let’s move ahead to know the eligibility of this course. The courses that you can pursue in vocational degree courses;
  • B.Voc. (Bachelor of Vocation)
  • D.Voc. (Diploma in Vocation)
The degree course is for three years and the diploma is for two years to learn the relevant specific domain to develop your skills.    Eligibility and Syllabus of the Course Vocational courses are expanded to a wide range of opportunities where you need to score 45-50% percentage in 12th standard to learn the vocational courses. Furthermore, vocational courses are skill-intensive where you need to think critically to generate productivity and there s no specific syllabus of the courses for 12th students.   

11. Certified Management Accountant (CMA)

The certified management accountant course is offered by The Institute of Cost and Work Accountants of India (ICWAI). The earliest, ICWAI used to offer a Cost and Works Accountancy (CWA) course. The CMA course is a combined element of CS and CA.  As it holds few common subjects of CS and CA course stream and it has three level of course as starts with Foundation, Intermediate, and followed by Final.  All 12th Standard passed students need to start with Foundation level and start the CMA course. The Foundation level will be for one year and the same is for the other two-level as well.  Let’s have a look over the eligibility and the syllabus of the CMA course. Here we go.    Eligibility and Syllabus of the Course You need to score a minimum of 60% percentage to start the CMA course. Now, the syllabus of the course is structured below respectively with the level.    Foundation Level: 
  • Fundamentals of economics And Management
  • Fundamentals of Accounting
  • Fundamentals of Laws and Ethics
  • Fundamentals of Business Mathematics and Statistics
  Intermediate Course: Group I
  • Financial Accounting
  • Laws and Ethics
  • Direct Taxation
  • Cost Accounting
Group II
  • Operations Management and Strategic Management
  • Cost and Management Accounting and Financial Management
  • Indirect Taxation
  • Company Accounts and Audit
  Final Course: Group I –
  • Corporate Laws and Compliance
  • Strategic Financial Management
  • Strategic Cost Management-Decision Making
  • Direct Tax Laws and International Taxation
           Group II-
  • Corporate Financial Reporting
  • Indirect Tax Laws and Practice
  • Cost and Management Audit
  • Strategic Performance Management and Business valuation
This is a complete syllabus of the Certified Management Accountant course. Well, this course is one of the most important courses after 12th for commerce.
